intro: Hibiscus ula, commonly known as the Malayan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to deep red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hibiscus ula thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
